intro: Eichlerodendron intermedium, commonly known as the Bursera intermedia, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the Burseraceae family, which includes frankincense and myrrh trees, and is characterized by its aromatic resins. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are often革质 (leathery) and have a glossy surface. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by spherical, woody fruits containing several seeds. The tree is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions.
